g.text: (TANGO Desktop, Märzhäuser Wetzlar) and the Z coordinate of the motorized
objective lens (× 20, Leica) were recorded using Labview. The spiral droplets were
allowed to move over at least twice the pitch before irradiation started. Confocal
ﬂuorescence imaging was performed with a using a Nikon confocal microscope and
488 nm. The emission was recorded using appropriate
. The droplets were irradiated using high intensity
365 nm). Light intensity was measured using a PM-100D power meter
. The movies were analyzed using a custom-written program in
The authors declare that the data supporting the ﬁndings of this study are available
within the paper and its supplementary information or from the corresponding authors

36. Seč, D., Porenta, T., Ravnik, M. & Žumer, S. Geometrical frustration of chiral
Inﬂuence of kinetics of chirality inversion on the reorientation. The spiral droplet shown here is doped with Me-
sufﬁciently low, the helical trajectory unwinds slowly and then rewinds with helix inversion. The insets show the structure of the droplet during motion, with
straight motion being associated with the disappearance of the spiral organization in the compensated state. The direction of the motion is not modiﬁed
signiﬁcantly upon transition from helical to straight
